recipe.notes:
Gum always made this for us when we'd come visiting. She used a ceramic blackbird poking through the center of the crust to keep it from collapsing in on itself overly much and to work as a vent. The little bastards are hard to find, but well worth the effort -- the pie wouldn't look the same without the little head peeping out.
This being said, my crust generally falls in but its still tasty.
recipe.name: Gum's Berry And Apple Pie
recipe.preparation:
Pare, slice and cook apples til soft (not mashed)--about 10 mins.
Mix flour and salt and cut in ice water slowly to form crust. Roll out and perhaps chill. I don't know -- I never end up making this right and this is more information than *I* ever had, so be thankful :)
Bake 35 to 45 minutes. Start at 450F for 10 minutes then step down to 350F.
